intro: Brachystegia apertifolia, commonly known as the open-cup tree, is a species of deciduous tree native to central and eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The tree is typically found in miombo woodlands and has a shallow root system adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Its bark is often fissured and may exude a milky sap when damaged.
